meanings.definition: Place or lay (one thing) over another, typically so that both are still evident.
meanings.sent1: She will superimpose the new logo on top of the old one.
meanings.sent2: The artist decided to superimpose different colors to create a unique painting.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally superimposed my face onto my cat's body in the photo.
meanings.sent4: His memories of childhood superimpose themselves onto his dreams, creating a surreal experience.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a projector to superimpose the map of the world onto the classroom wall.

meanings.definition: Combine (two or more things) to form a single entity.
meanings.sent1: Let's superimpose the two puzzle pieces to complete the picture.
meanings.sent2: The chef will superimpose the flavors of garlic and herbs in the dish.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally superimposed my shopping list with my friend's, and now we have double the groceries.
meanings.sent4: Her voice seemed to superimpose with the melody, creating a beautiful harmony.
meanings.sent5: The merger will superimpose two companies into a single, stronger entity.
